data.title: Very unique place
data.text: Wow! What a neat little hidden surprise. It had been suggested to come here. We love Bourbon! However this place is like going back in time. Old Fashion and Weller. They have a very amazing bourbon list! 8 pages

data.title: Century Bar
data.text: Looks closed, but it's not! What a find! Went there all three nights in town after hitting nearby Oregon district. Outstanding place with a very old school ambiance. Great place for nite cap right downtown. Didn't try food but bartenders were helpful and cool.

data.title: Great burgers!
data.text: A Dayton landmark with one of the best back bars in Dayton. Pub food but still worth eating here. The outside can hardly give you an idea what a terrific place is inside.

data.title: AWESOME Place!
data.text: I have been to half a dozen bourbon bars in other Cities but NOTHING compares to this place. The ambience was amazing with the high ceilings and dark wood. All the bartenders were dressed in "period" attire and each had classic beards and or mustaches. And the place played music I have not heard in years...guess you would call it Swing music from the 20s and 30s. Of course the bourbon and drink selection was excellent. Only "issue" was we darn near did not come in because from the outside ot looks like the place is closed!! HIGHLY recommend this place!

data.title: Classic & Classy Bourbon Bar
data.text:
Look at the sign for the Century Bourbon Bar, and it will tell you everything you need to know. Old world, authentic, serious.  And it's safe.

I love, love this bar.  The menu of bourbons is long and outstanding. The imported over-the-top antique bar sets the tone (along with candle lighting at the bourbon-barrel tables). The bartenders are knowledgeable and take their craft seriously. This is a grown-ups bar for intentional drinking.  I was a little unsure and hesitated to walk in for years. Don't make my mistake.  This is, as one reviewer said a gem in the Gem City.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Time jump back to 1919.  Ragtime and Jazz music.  Great Cocktails and Bourbon and Whiskys.  Great place to go.  No food.  I would go back.

data.title: What an awesome place!
data.text: The Century Bar is probably one of my favourite places to go in Downtown Dayton.  The interior of the bar is to DIE for.  The drinks are decently priced, and made like they would have been made in the early 1900's!

data.title: A True Gem in the Gem City
data.text: I could not believe such an awesome bar resides in downtown Dayton.  The drinks are some of the best I've ever had - don't miss the Manhattan.  I also had something that had insanely good bourbon with champagne but as it was my second drink, I simply forgot.  The bartenders are really fun and are truly passionate about what they do.  I'm already planning my next trip to this world class bar!

data.title: Coolest Bar in Dayton
data.text: Love the vibe and all the drinks.  Not suprised they end up on the best bourbon bars in the country over and over.

data.title: One of the Top Bourbon Bars in the USA!!!
data.text: A must see in Dayton Ohio.  Over 100 Bourbons and staff who eagerly explain all things Bourbon.  If you prefer Scotch, Century has a vast selection too.  Excellent cocktails for those who want to enjoy the company of fine Bourbon drinkers. Eclectic and friendly crowd on all nights!

data.title: Greatest little bourbon bar
data.text: All the staff are extremely knowledgeable on the bourbons and drinks they provide. This place is not just about serving liquor but more about where it comes from and is going.

data.title: Trying something new
data.text: Met some friends here for a meeting and I was a little worried about going to a new place downtown but I was so thankful I did. The atmosphere alone will make you feel as though you stepped back in time. The woodwork behind the bar is magnificent and the whole vibe and decor is so inviting. I even liked the bartenders who were very knowledgable about the many drink combinations offered. I tried a few new things that night and left learning. Few things too. If you are looking for a place to chill and enjoy the evening give this place a try.

data.title: Step back into time at the Century Bar!
data.text: Surrounded by closed up store fronts but the bar is awesome and the bar tender we had knew his stuff and shared his knowledge with my husband and I.

data.title: Huge Selection of Bourbon and Whiskey!!
data.text: Great place to get quality cocktails and bourbon. The bartenders are top notch and very knowledgeable. Dark decor and a really cool atmosphere, I cant wait to go back.

data.title: Whiskey lovers, with me!
data.text:
They simply have the best selection of Bourbons on the Northern side of the Ohio River. The staff is friendly and they don't mind spending a word to illustrate what is being poured in the glass.
The possibility of having tasting flights is a plus for whiskey newbies or simply for the curious. Few rarities are available, including legendary Pappy Van Winkle.
No food - you can bring in a pizza from across the street, if you want, and sit at a table to eat while you sip.

data.title: The Bourbon Zone
data.text: Walking in the door was like entering another world. Glittering, old world woodwork; just-right jazz from the 1930s; and two bartenders who looked like they stepped out of an old portrait. Note that this isn't a restaurant; the menu is a list of 100+ bourbons.

data.title: This is a Bourbon Bar
data.text: Stopped in and was dark and what you expect good selection of 125 bourbons plus scotch,  rye,  etc.... and 40s and 50s music.  This is a man's man's place!

data.title: Step Back in Time
data.text:
When I stepped into the Century Bar, through a door that looks out without allowing one to look in, I could barely see the aisle in front of me, it is so dark. Along one wall is a beautiful lovingly crafted wooden bar with the requisite bar to ceiling mirrors and deco art glass lights in the ceiling. Along the other side are tables made from oak barrels with round tops surrounded by three or four barstools matching those at the bar. There is a larger room in the back, and I headed there because the slightly brighter lights over a table for 8-10 were inviting.

But after a few minutes my eyes adjusted and I made my way back into the main room to sit across from the bar and be joined by friends.

What is great: 
The ambiance. On a weeknight it is happy but quiet, with a deeply Americana vibe. 
The bartenders know their stuff cold. But they aren't only extraordinarily knowledgable about the whiskeys and bourbons for which the bar is well known. Those come by the dozen and are lovingly described and poured. 
They also have a short list of cocktails, and can make whatever you like, though I assume sticking to the classics is going to be your best bet. But they do cocktails the old fashioned, Casablanca/Maltese Falcon silver screen kind of way. Jack and Coke is better made with real sugar cubes for balance… the Last Word is sweet with cherry and chartreuse but packs a slow punch. And the Amaretto Sour is a must. Made with frothed egg whites atop amaretto and simple syrup, all expertly shaken and poured - with no sour mix- it is perfection. It's all about the craft here. No sprite clumsily topped on amaretto, no lazy lists for amateur mixologists. These guys are the real deal.
They will be helpful when you want, but they leave you alone. We enjoyed great conversation for over two hours, listening to piped in jazz, lazing in the dark shadows of the wood paneled room, basking in soft and hazy light.

What is not so great: 
They only have barstools to sit on. If you're young and spry and fit to a stool easily and have no back complaints and are not a larger sized person, you're fine. But I have shorter legs and a more ample body, and today I can still feel the ache of sitting on a backless stool with no place for my feet but the rungs beneath me (barrel tables = cool. no place to dangle feet = not so cool)
There were some folks who looked like they brought in food. I have read a review saying they offer food. That may be on weekends or special nights. To my knowledge, there was no food, which is really only an issue if you're drinking and need something to sop it up a bit.
Finally, there were no servers on the weeknight. This was really NOT a problem. But you need to know.

One related issue is parking. The lot behind the bar is usable but cost $4 and may cost more or less on given nights. There is parallel parking on the street but of course, this means you may have to hunt, and you need change.

While I'm still looking for a loungey, girls-night-out friendly, chat and have cocktails with fruit in them kind of place for a midweek meet up with my girlfriends, I absolutely will return to the bar with my man or another couple or visitors for the expert drinks and interesting Last Century feel.

data.title: Bourbon Drinkers Paradise
data.text: While I am not much of a Bourbon drinker, this is the place to go if you are.  The staff is friendly and knowledgable and they have a great selection.  A hidden gem in Dayton!

data.title: Classic old time bar
data.text: One of Dayton's oldest bars and its classic décor and great whiskey selection make it worth a quick visit. As it turns out they also have delicious burgers and deli sandwiches. If you want to feel old school and a bit manly, give The Century a try.
